D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\build.gradle:42: Warning: JCenter Maven repository is no longer receiving updates: newer library versions may be available elsewhere [JcenterRepositoryObsolete]
        jcenter()
        ~~~~~~~~~
D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\build.gradle:107: Warning: JCenter Maven repository is no longer receiving updates: newer library versions may be available elsewhere [JcenterRepositoryObsolete]
    jcenter()
    ~~~~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "JcenterRepositoryObsolete":
   The JCenter Maven repository is no longer accepting submissions of Maven
   artifacts since 31st March 2021.  Ensure that the project is configured to
   search in repositories with the latest versions of its dependencies.

   https://developer.android.com/r/tools/jcenter-end-of-service

D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\build.gradle:46: Warning: A newer version of com.android.tools.build:gradle than 3.6.4 is available: 8.13.1 [AndroidGradlePluginVersion]
            classpath 'com.android.tools.build:gradle:3.6.4'
                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "AndroidGradlePluginVersion":
   This detector looks for usage of the Android Gradle Plugin where the
   version you are using is not the current stable release. Using older
   versions is fine, and there are cases where you deliberately want to stick
   with an older version. However, you may simply not be aware that a more
   recent version is available, and that is what this lint check helps find.

    ^

D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\src\main\java\com\reactnativecommunity\asyncstorage\AsyncStorageModule.java:366: Warning: This AsyncTask class should be static or leaks might occur (anonymous com.facebook.react.bridge.GuardedAsyncTask) [StaticFieldLeak]

D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\src\main\java\com\reactnativecommunity\asyncstorage\AsyncStorageModule.java:389: Warning: This AsyncTask class should be static or leaks might occur (anonymous com.facebook.react.bridge.GuardedAsyncTask) [StaticFieldLeak]
    new GuardedAsyncTask<Void, Void>(getReactApplicationContext()) {
    ^
D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\src\main\java\com\reactnativecommunity\asyncstorage\ReactDatabaseSupplier.java:40: Warning: Do not place Android context classes in static fields (static reference to ReactDatabaseSupplier which has field mContext pointing to Context); this is a memory leak [StaticFieldLeak]
  private static @Nullable ReactDatabaseSupplier sReactDatabaseSupplierInstance;
          ~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "StaticFieldLeak":
   A static field will leak contexts.

   Non-static inner classes have an implicit reference to their outer class.
   If that outer class is for example a Fragment or Activity, then this
   reference means that the long-running handler/loader/task will hold a
   reference to the activity which prevents it from getting garbage
   collected.

   Similarly, direct field references to activities and fragments from these
   longer running instances can cause leaks.

   ViewModel classes should never point to Views or non-application Contexts.

D:\wamp\www\FUNERALCALL\app\node_modules\@react-native-async-storage\async-storage\android\build.gradle:124: Warning: This library supports using KSP instead of kapt, which greatly improves performance. Learn more: https://developer.android.com/studio/build/migrate-to-ksp [KaptUsageInsteadOfKsp]
        kapt "androidx.room:room-compiler:$room_version"
        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "KaptUsageInsteadOfKsp":
   KSP is a more efficient replacement for kapt. For libraries that support
   both, KSP should be used to improve build times.

   https://developer.android.com/studio/build/migrate-to-ksp

0 errors, 11 warnings
